texts.es: Horinson con su credikiva anterior compró rapidamente pescado en mayor volumen y así mismo los vendió, Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo finamciamiento con Kiva porque le fue muy bien, y quiere repetir, por eso hizo su preventa y le encargaron, pescado salmon,robalo, jurel, camaron y sierra. Con este nuevo financiamiento espera mejorar aun mas el servicio a su clientela, para conservarla. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Estoy muy contento con su ayuda ya que mi negocio está creciendo mas y he mejorado mis ingresos, muchisimas gracias y que Dios los bendiga. "
texts.en: Horinson used his previous Kiva loan to quickly buy fish in large amounts and he sold them.  Today, he’s applying for a new loan with Kiva because he did very well and he wants to repeat.  This is why he did a presale and he has orders for salmon, sea bass, scad, shrimp and swordfish.  He hopes to improve customer service still more with this loan so that he can retain his clientele.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very happy with your help because my business is growing and I’ve improved my income.  Thank you very much and may God bless you.”

loans.use: to buy salmon, sea bass, scad, shrimp and swordfish.

loans.name: Oerm

texts.en:
Oerm, a 27-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children to take care of, and they are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for ten years and also makes and sells grilled sticky rice. Her husband earns additional income by working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. 

Her husband’s old motorbike is breaks down too often, which has the effect of making the family's income unstable. In order to solve this problem, she is applying for a loan of US $1,000 from VisionFund to purchase a decent motorbike for her husband’s business. This is the first loan for Oerm with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She hopes this loan will help her husband generate a larger income from his motorbike transportation business. This will help the family improve its standard of living and keep the children in school.

loans.use: To purchase a decent motorbike for her husband’s business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Ibrahim II. He is married and has four children aged 8, 12, 14 and 17 years, all attending school. In 1995, Ibrahim II established his business selling second-hand school bags and building materials. He began his business because his father was a farmer, and going to school was not an option as the farm needed his help. He worked through his teenage years in the village with his family, and then decided to join a friend in Makeni Town in his second-hand business.

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, Ibrahim II earns about Le 875,000 every month, usually selling his goods to peddlers and passersby. Shortage of supplies is his major problem. Having already received and repaid three loans, he is now requesting a new one for Le 4,000,000 to purchase the following: second-hand bags - 3 bales @ Le1,000,000; locks - 1 carton @ Le400,000; shine papers - 2 rolls @ Le150,000, and nails - 1 carton @ Le300,000.

Hardworking and reliable, Ibrahim II hopes to continue with this credit service so that he can develop himself. The loan will help as he is progressing gradually. In the future, he hopes to be supplier. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase second handed bags - 3 bales @ Le1,000,000, locks - 1 carton @ Le400,000, shine papers - 2 rolls @ Le150,000 and nails - 1 cartons @ Le300,000.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 53-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has no children. In 2010, Mohamed established his provision business. He began his business because he wants to develop his family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mohamed now requires a new loan in order to buy more provisions of different types. In the future, Mohamed plans to give a good education to his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase his stock in very large quantities

loans.name: Zainab O.

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Zainab O. She is married and has one child who is 15 years old and attends school. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered. In 2010, Zainab O. established her business selling household utensils. She began her business as she dropped out of school because of having a single parent. She used to assist her father after school hours. When she became an adult, she got married, and because her husband knows her business background he established a business for her. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 3,252,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Zainab O. requires a loan in order to purchase the following:
  • pans - 25 sets @ 70,000 SLL
  • stoves - 10 pieces @ 60,000 SLL
  • coolman - 15 pieces @ 90,000 SLL
  • glass cups - 3 dozen @ 96,000 SLL
The balance, 12,000 SLL, will be used to pay laborers. In the future, Zainab O. plans to build a house, acquire another outlet, and provide a quality education for her children. This loan will help to increase her stock. Some items are fragile and will get spoiled easily. She is a hardworking business woman. She thanks ARD for providing additional capital for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase pans (25 sets @ 70,000 SLL), stoves (10 pieces @ 60,000 SLL), coolman (15 pieces @ 90,000 SLL), and glass cups (3 dozen @ 96,000 SLL). The balance, 12,000 SLL, will be used to pay laborers.

loans.name: Zainab Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Zainab. She is married and has 4 children, ages 11 months, 8, 11, and 19. Two are school-going children. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered. In 2010, Zainab established her household utensils business. She began her business because she dropped out of school at Form II level, and her parents gave her in marriage to a businessman. Her husband gave her some money to start a business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,559,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Zainab requires a loan in order to buy the following items:
  • coolman - 15 pieces @ 130,000 SLL
  • flasks - 16 pieces @ 40,000 SLL
  • set pans - 1 dozen @ 960,000 SLL
  • glass cups - 6 dozen @ 72,000 SLL
  • plastic plates - 1 dozen @ 18,000 SLL
In the future, Zainab plans to build a house, educate her children, open another outlet, and become an international businesswoman. This loan will help her achieve some of her future plans. Her current problems include inadequate capital and the fact that some items, like set pans, will get damaged when traveling. She is a hardworking and honest businesswoman. She hopes to repay the loan and access another. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy coolman (15 pieces @ 130,000 SLL), flasks (16 pieces @ 40,000 SLL), set pans (1 dozen @ 960,000 SLL), glass cups (6 dozen @ 72,000 SLL), and plastic plates (1 dozen @ 18,000 SLL).

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es:
El señor Martin Encarnacion esta unido de hecho, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo, el cual aun no están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, como son, pantalones y camisa, inicio este trabajo trabajando con una maquina mecánica y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran, para la compra de una maquina industrial, la cual les permitirá aumentar su nivel de producción y desempeños, esperan en el futuro tener una maquila propio y con empleados. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la confección de prendas.
texts.en:
Martín Encarnación, 25, is actually in a relationship and has a son not yet attending school; he completed third grade.  He works sewing fabrics like pants and shirts.  He started the business with a standard sewing machine and to date has six years’ experience. He gets help from his wife who does the same kind of work.

He organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine that will allow them to increase production and jobs.  They hope in future to have an assembly plant of their own with employees.  

The other group members work raising animals and making clothes.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine.

loans.name: Emiro Rafael

texts.es: Emiro  de 33 años de edad, se dedica al lavado de motocicletas, negocio con el que ha logrado sostener su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 2 a 11 años. A Emiro los conductores de este vehículo, le llevan sus motocicletas para para que además de lavárselas, les aplique cera. Últimamente los clientes de Emiro, son mucho más y su máquina no alcanza a cubrir rápidamente esta demanda; esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará una máquina para lavar y trabajar con más  holgado. Emiro está muy satisfecho con su negocio, pues el cumple el propósito por el cual lo creó, que fue el de generar ingresos para tener cada vez mas, bienestar para su familia. Sus principales clientes son los mototransportadores, a quienes atiende diariamente durante todo el día, pero todo su trabajo lo hace con mucho empeño y dedicación.
texts.en: Emiro, 33, works washing motorcycles, a business that allows him to support his home composed of his spouse and four children ranging in age from 2 to 11.  Motorcycle drivers bring their cycles to Emiro so that in addition to washing them he’ll wax them.  Lately, Emiro’s clientele has grown much and he can’t cover demand fast enough.  This is the reason he’s applying for a Kiva loan so that he can buy a machine to wash them with and work more efficiently.  Emiro is very satisfied with his business because it meets the purpose for which he created it which was to generate income so that his family would be better off every day.  His main customers are transportation providers who he tends to all day, every day but with much dedication and attention to detail.

loans.use: to buy a machine to wash vehicles.

loans.name: Soktang's Group

texts.en:
Soktang is 25 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one daughter in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Ratanak Mondul district. Corn growing is the primary source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for ten years. Her daily income is approximately 18,000 KHR. She manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after off-setting daily expenses. Scarcity of water supply and working capital is the main challenge for her farming business. 

Soktang has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and fully paid back the past loan while the other member is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She successfully and wisely utilized the previous loan to secure food needs for her family and also to support the family with enough household supplies for consumption. Now she is leading her group of two to request another loan. She is going to use her portion to buy insecticides for protecting her corn business and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to grow her corn fruitfully and increase her income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy insecticides for protecting her corn business

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus hijos y nieto en casa propia; ella posee una tortillería, tiene varios años de poseerla y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le ayuda a mejorar su producción y por lo tanto a obtener buenas ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su residencia en una comunidad muy transitada de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo es elaborado con material de primera calidad, buenos precios y sobre todo un servicio excelente; Dora es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y no posee suficiente materia prima para la producción necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Dora Alicia  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica
texts.en:
Dora Alicia, age 44, lives with her life partner and their children and grandson in their own home. She owns a tortilla shop and has had this business for many years, which has given her a lot of valuable experience that helps her to improve her output, at the same time increasing her profits. The business is located in her home in a heavily-trafficked community. She has made a lot of customers, as they prefer her because everything she sells is made with the finest ingredients, offered a good prices, and above all delivered with excellent service. 

Dora is an enterprising woman with a big desire to get ahead. She's always on the lookout for new opportunities that can allow her to achieve success. In recent weeks, demand has been going up and she doesn't have enough ingredients to keep up her production. So, she needs to invest because she doesn't have sufficient capital on hand. That's why she's requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] that will allow her to buy corn at wholesale. Dora Alicia has a good payment history and is morally beyond reproach. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the loan and is confident that it will bring greater economic stability to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Rosa Group

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer de 49, viuda, y madre de 2 hijos, ambos mayores de 25 años. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora,  con la motivación y capacidad de detectar oportunidades de mercado y así obtener beneficios económicos para ella y continuar ayudando y sus hijos y nietos. La actividad que desarrolla es la porcicultura, y tiene una producción que ha ido creciendo gracias a la ayuda de los 3 financiamientos que ha recibido. Para esta solicitud ella quiere invertir en la compra de cerdos, alimentos, concentrados y vitaminas. Los créditos para Doña Lucia representan la herramienta que le permite ser una mujer independiente y exitosa.  Junto a Lucia hay una socia más que va a invertir en la misma actividad productiva.
texts.en:
Lucia, 49, is a widow and the mother of two children, both older than 25.  She's a very enterprising woman with the motivation and ability to profit from market opportunities to continue helping her children and grandchildren.  Her job is raising pigs, and her business has grown thanks to the three loans she has received.

For this request she wants to invest in buying pigs, feed, concentrate, and vitamins.

For Lucia, a loan is a tool that allows her to be an independent and successful woman.  There's another woman with Lucia who also wants to invest in the same productive activity.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, concentrate, and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo es soltero, tiene 19  años de edad, Ricardo   estudia Contabilidad  en una universidad privada de prestigio, Ricardo escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente a su vez estudia ingles americano. Su sueño de Ricardo  es  estudiar una Maestría en Tributacion Y Derecho y  con el tiempo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y pension, Ricardo cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo Y agradece a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 19, is single and studying accounting at a prestigious, private university.  Ricardo chose this career because it’s his vocation and he has the capacity and skills to develop professionally; he’s also studying American English.

Ricardo’s dream is to earn a Master’s Degree in Tax Law and in time provide a better quality of life for his parents.  In order to continue to grow he’s asking for a new loan to pay tuition and board.  Ricardo will meet his goals with much work and effort.  He thanks Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition and board.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Haja. She is married and has two children aged four and ten years. Both are school-going children. In 2002, Haja established her cosmetics business. She began her business after she dropped out of high school when she became pregnant. Her parents asked her fiancee to marry  her because they thought it was not necessary for her to go to school anymore. She wished to go school, but she had to accept her fate.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 827,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Haja requires the loan in order to stock her business. She will purchase Bio-Clear Cream (three cartons at Le 230,000); Razac Cream (four dozen at Le 180,000); Vaseline (four bundles at Le 100,000); Doctor Clear Cream (one carton at Le 190,000) and Pure Black Spray (ten dozen at Le 100,000). 

In the future, Haja plans to further her studies and set up a well-established business to support her family. The loan will help greatly. Competition is her major challenge.  She is very competitive and hardworking. To generate business effectively she needs enough capital, so she is grateful for this loan.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase Bio-Clear Cream, Razac Cream, Vaseline, Doctor Clear Cream and Pure Black Spray to stock her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Maria Marcos

texts.es: María Marcos vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace ya varios años se ha hecho de mucha experiencia y eso le ayuda a obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia en una comunidad muy concurrida de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por sus exquisitas pupusas, por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el servicio inigualable siempre al servicio de los clientes; María es una mujer ejemplar, dedicada a su labor le gusta luchar por lo que desea, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo por ganarse un futuro mejor y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le  permita comprar maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón, etc. María Marcos tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Marcos lives with her life partner and their children. She has been selling pupusas for several years already and has gained a lot of experience, which helps her make the best profits she can. Her business is located in her home in a community with a lot of foot traffic. She has made a lot of customers, as people prefer her for her exquisite pupusas, their quality, low prices, and above all her unparalleled service. María is a model woman, dedicated to her work, who loves fighting for her dreams. Every day she puts in her best effort to make herself a better future and never thinks of giving up until she has achieved success. Like any good merchant, she wants to grow her business but doesn't have enough capital on hand, which brought her to request this loan from Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] that will allow her to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork, etc. María has a good payment history and is morally beyond reproach. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the loan and hopes that it will provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy varnish, screws, sandpaper, lumber, glue and paint.

loans.name: Ruben Emilio

texts.es:
Rubén, 30 años, es joven emprendedor originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica a realizar trabajas de pintura, enderezado y pintura una pequeña y antigua máquina de soldar y un soplete son las principales herramientas con las que él logra conseguir el alimento diario y mantener a su negocio. Este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven cuando tenía 17 años de edad con la fe de algún día poner su propio taller de pintura y enderezado y lo logro ya tiene un año de estar funcionando.
Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar material para soldadura y  un compresor, pues necesita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener maquinas en buen estado es indispensable. Dentro de sus metas esta comprar una motocicleta para movilizarse  en su trabajo y comprar nuevas herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rubén, 30, is a young entrepreneur from the city of Estelí.  He does paint and body work with a small, antique soldering machine and blowtorch; these are his main work tools he uses to earn his daily bread and stay in business.  He learned this occupation at the age of 17 always trusting that someday he’d have his own paint and body shop and now he does; he’s been in operation a year.

He needs financing to buy soldering supplies and an air compressor because he needs to improve customer service and having machines that are in good operating condition is vital.  In his goals is to buy a motorcycle to get around with for work and to buy new work tools.

loans.use: to buy soldering supplies and an air compressor.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 2 and 4 years old. In 1991, Aminata established her Rice by Bags business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of their home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Amanita requires a loan in order to buy 50 bags of rice, water, mega cola drinks and soft drinks. In the future, Aminata plans to assist her husband in completing the house they are now building and plans to educate their children into university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice, water, mega cola drinks and soft drinks for her business, Rice By Bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks and food to increase profits at her provisions and drinks business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has 1 child, aged 3yrs. He also has 3 additional dependents. In 2009, Mohamed established his Local food stuff ( garri-a granular ingredient made from dried cassava--and palm oil) business. He began his business because he wanted to increase his income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more bags of Garri and Palm Oil. In the future, Mohamed plans to established more business outlets and build houses. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of garri (150 to 200 bags)

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia  desde que llego al  barrio donde actualmente ella radica se puso un pequeño negocio. Se compro una vitrina y perchas de allí ella vende laminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño de Patricia es ampliar más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Y Ella cuenta que quisiera arreglar su vivienda la cual vive con su esposo que por ahora se encuentra sin trabajo ese es el sueño que ella tiene . Con el préstamo quisiera comprar: cuadernos , papeles , laminas, ropa etc
texts.en:
Patricia set up a small business after she arrived in the neighborhood where she currently lives.  She bought herself a display case and stands to sell paper, notebooks, even gift items.

She tends the store alone because she works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.  She says that in the beginning there was a lot of crime in the area and she didn't have much business.  Little by little the conditions have improved, though, and now it's going very well for her in her business.

Patricia's dream is to expand more to be able to satisfy the demands of her daily customers.  She also says she would like to fix up her house, where she lives with her husband, who currently isn't working.  That's her dream.

With the loan she wants to buy notebooks, paper, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Castorina

texts.es: Castorina, una mujer muy trabajadora, ha mostrado a sus fondeadores que tiene buen sentido comercial con el reembolso final de su crédito. Ella usó el crédito para adquirir telas e insumos para su confección de uniformes deportivos, donde trabaja todos los días para proveer para sus 2 hijos. Castorina ahora aplica un nuevo crédito para comprar una máquina de bordado, porque actualmente ella tiene que solicitar este servicio. Si ella puede comprar esta máquina, podrá bordar ella misma, ahorrando más para sus ingresos.  Castorina quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores: “Muy agradecida, me han servido mucho sus créditos. He avanzado bastante y me esta yendo muy bien.”
texts.en:
Castorina’s a hardworking woman who has demonstrated to lenders by totally repaying her loan that she has good business sense.  She used the loan to buy fabric and supplies to manufacture sports uniforms.  She works every day to provide for her two children.

Castorina is now applying for a new loan to buy an embroidery machine because she currently has to subcontract this type of service.  If she can buy the machine, she will be able to do the embroidery herself thus saving more income.  

Castorina would like to say the following to her lenders:  “I am very grateful.  Your loans have been very useful for me.  I have advanced quite a bit and am doing very well.”

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Don Víctor un hombre de 42 años, casado, agricultor vive en Sololá con su esposa y 6 hijos  de los cuales la mas grande de una mujer de 18 años que trabaja independientemente y los 5 mas son menores que estudian en la escuela de su comunidad.
Un hombre trabajador dispuesto a salir a delante con su familia trabajando fuertemente en la agricultura. Se dedica al cultivo de Cebolla, zanahoria, repollo, ejote y papa en un municipio cercano a su residencia ya que es donde se puede cosechar mejores verduras y obtener buenos precios al momento de su  venta. 
El aprendió este trabajo con sus padres desde que el dejo de estudiar en la escuela el tercer año de primaria  y ahora con su esposa y sus hijos lleva 15 años cultivando este tipo de verduras para poder tener ingresos económicos y mantener a su familia.
Por la temporada del año donde el precio de algunas verduras mejoran ahora el ve que necita un capital en efectivo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y  fertilizante orgánico para luego cultivarlos, cosecharlos y poder venderlos en el mercado local y en otros departamentos.
Don Víctor sueña que para un futuro tener un negocio para sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor, 42, is married and works in agriculture.  He lives in Solalá with his wife and six children the eldest being an 18-year-old girl who works independently.  The other five are minors attending school in their community.

He’s a hardworking man determined to get ahead with his family by working hard in agriculture.  He grows carrots, onions, cabbage, green beans and potatoes in a municipality near his home which is where he can harvest better vegetables and earn good prices at the moment they are sold.

He learned this work with his parents since he left school in third grade.  He and his wife have now been working the land for 15 years growing this type of vegetables to earn income and support the family.

For the season of the year when the price of some vegetables improves, he needs Q 4,000.00 to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer to grow, harvest and sell them in the local market and in other departments.

Victor dreams with having a business for his children in the future and to improve his entire family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Oscar Jose

texts.es:
Oscar, 49 años de edad, de oficio mecánico, padre de 4 hijos, originario de Estelí. Esta actividad la empezó desde  muy joven, el negocio lo puso su padre que al morir lo dejo a cargo a él la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedica a este negocio, con el cual mantiene a su familia, paga la educación de sus hijos y mantiene activo sus servicios como mecánico.  
El desea hacerles mejoras de infraestructura a su taller el cual tiene parte del techo deteriorado y además no tiene protección segura para proteger a los vehículos de sus clientes por eso invertirá para comprar material de construcción como cemento, hierro, zinc para acondicionar mejor su taller. Esto le permitirá darle una mejor presentación a su negocio  y brindarle mejor seguridad a los vehículos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oscar, 49, is a mechanic by profession.  He’s the father of four children and he’s from Estelí.  He started this activity while still very young.  The business was started by his father and when he died he left it to him.  He’s spent most of his life in this business and supports his family by means of it.  He pays for his children’s schooling and keeps his mechanic services active.

He wants to make some improvements to his shop’s infrastructure; part of the roof is damaged and he also does not have a way of providing security for his customers’ vehicles so he will invest in buying building materials and supplies like cement, rebar and metal sheeting to better equip his shop.  This will allow his business to have a better appearance as well as to provide security for his customers’ vehicles.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar and metal sheeting to better equip his shop.

loans.name: Yabo

texts.fr: Yabo est âgée de 37ans. Mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont deux sont encore scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 23ans et 06ans. Couturière de formation, elle vend de la mercerie dans une boutique sise au cœur de la ville puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer son capital et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui financier lui permettra d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Yabo, age 37, is married and mother to four children, two of whom have already completed school. The oldest and youngest are, respectively, 23 and 6 years old. A dress-maker by trade, she sells her merchandise in a store situated in the heart of the city and buys her provisions in one of the markets in Bénin and outside the country as well. Out of concern for bolstering her available stock and satisfying the needs of her clients, she has requested and received financial aide from Finadev Bénin [Kiva field partner]. This financial support will allow her to increase her supplementary income and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 cases of buttons, 2 cases of thread spools, 3 dozen boxes of clasps, and 2 rolls of poplin fabric.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, aged 56 years old, is a married mother of four children who has been engaged in cassava growing in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been in this business for five years. Pov’s husband also works as a paid worker in a local area to earn additional income for the family. This current occupation earns them approximately 30,000KHR per day and they manage to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. Low yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for Pov's farming business. 

Pov received her first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and has gone through five cycles already while the other member of the group is just with VisionFund this cycle. Pov has fully paid back the loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and has improved their livelihood. Now she and her group member are applying for another loan to buy household supplies such as a bed and kitchen supplies. Through this loan, she hopes to grow her current business to earn a larger income so as to make convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy household supplies such as a bed and kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
Toch, 39, is a rice farmer in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and they are still in school in the local area. She has been growing rice on two hectares of farmland for fifteen years. 

Toch has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle while the other member is new to VisionFund this cycle. Toch completely repaid the first loan which has helped her to send her children to school and also support the family with sufficient food. Now she and her fellow group member would like to request another loan of KHR 200,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so as to keep up a good progress of her lifestyle and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Abdulai.  He is married and has 3 children, ages 10, 8 and 5. In 2002, Abdulai established his Provision and Drinks business. He began his business because he wants to take care of his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs a day, he earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Abdulai requires a loan in order to purchase provisions and drinks for him to be able to compete with other traders in the area. In the future, Abdulai plans use his profits to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and drinks for him to be able to compete with other traders in the area.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has 2 children, aged 6 and 18. In 2008, Salamatu established her firewood, palm oil and local foodstuff business. She started the business to help her husband, who is a driver, in running the home and to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,992,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to add to her stock and expand. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 318,720. In the future, Salamatu plans to improve the business and to be able to take care of her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for firewood

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Joseph.  He is married and has 3 children aged 8, 11 and 14. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him to help a brother with his education.  In 2005, Joseph established his motorbike rental business. He started the business to be self-sustainable after dropping out of school. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Joseph has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy a new motorbike. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 263,700. In the future, Joseph plans to increase the number of motorbikes with profit earned from the business.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Daniel Fabricio

texts.es: Daniel tiene 27 años de edad estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos, El comenzó su negocio de producción de ventas de ladrillos , el empieza su jornada de trabajo cuando se levanta a las 5.00am hasta l 16:00pm con 2 ayudante el sueño de Daniel es tener una mayor producción de ladrillos. Con el préstamo él quiere comprar tierra, aserrín, leña,
texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old, is in a civil union, and has two children. He operates a small business making and selling bricks, and works from 5:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. He has two assistants who help him with the work load. Daniel's dream is to improve and strengthen his brick production business.

With the support from this loan, Daniel plans to purchase dirt, sawdust and firewood for making bricks.

loans.use: to purchase dirt, sawdust, and firewood for making bricks.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad estado civil casada , tiene hijos que estudian en la escuela , ella comenta que el trabajo que esta es la venta bebidas energizante , bebidas con te que  dan fuerza al organismo , ya que una amiga la motivo a que vendiera eso por en el mercado son pocos quienes vende eso .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar más cajas de sobre energizante para vender
texts.en:
María, 45, is married and has children who are in school.  She comments that her job is selling energy drinks, tea drinks that give strength to the body.  A friend motivated her to sell this because there are few people in the market.

With the loan she wants to buy more cases of energy powder to sell.

loans.use: to buy cases of powder for energy drinks

loans.name: Bernarda Lilly

texts.es:
Bernarda,  40 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 16 años de edad, el cual está estudiando la secundaria. Ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería en la ciudad de Estelí. Esta actividad la inicio su mama quien fue la que empezó la pulpería después de 10 años se hizo cargo del  negocio, esto le ha permitido sobrevivir con su hijo, pagar los gastos del hogar, ser más independiente. Una de sus ideas a futuro es poner pequeños kioscos en el mercado y cafetería de hospitales esto como una manera de diversificar sus negocios  siempre en busca de superarse para sacar adelante a su familia.  
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para para comprar granos básicos, aceite, cosméticos ,pollo, carne, gaseosas. Todos productos de diario consumo y de mucha necesidad en los clientes de su vecindario.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 40 years old and is the mother of a 16-year-old son who is in secondary school.  She makes a living as a shopkeeper and owns a small grocery store in the city of Estelí.  This activity began with her mother who started the store, and Bernarda took charge of the business after 10 years.  The store has made it possible for Bernarda and her son to survive, to pay for the household expenses, and to be more independent.  One of her ideas for the future is to open small kiosks in the market and in hospital cafeterias, which would be one way to diversify her business.  Bernarda is always looking for ways to improve in order for her family to get ahead.

Bernarda needs a loan so she can purchase staple grains, oil, cosmetics, chicken, beef, and soft drinks.  All of these products are basic necessities and are much needed by customers in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, oil, cosmetics, chicken, beef, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Brillian Material - 1 bale @ Le4,000,000, Caustic Soda - 8 bags @ Le120,000.  The balance Le40,000 will be used as transportation.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Musu. She is married and has 2 children aged 3 and 7 years old. In 2005, Musu established her blouse, slippers, jewelry and baby clothing business. She started the business to help her husband, who is also in business, to maintain their home and also to meet her personal needs. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,215,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Musu requires a loan in order to buy panties, napkins, Pampers and ladies' slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 303,750. In the future, Musu plans to expand her business to the outskirts of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy panties, napkins, Pampers and ladies' slippers to sell for her business.

loans.name: Momoh

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Momoh. He is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 7 years old. He has one additional dependent living with him. In 2007, Momoh established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because he could not continue in school as there was no money. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from his business. 

Momoh would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy more crates of soft drinks to store as the year is approaching the festive seasons. In the future, Momoh plans to become an international business man and supply other business men and women. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks in a large quantity to sell for the festive season.

loans.name: Maria  Auxilio

texts.es:
Maria, 49 años de edad, comerciante, madre de 4 hijos, su nivel escolar es básico, solo finalizo la primaria. Vive en la ciudad de Managua hace 4 años emprendió con su negocio de venta de comida, solo tenía 3 libras de arroz, carne y un litro de aceite no tenía mucha materia prime pero si  gran expectativa de surgir. Poco a poco fue aumentando sus ventas, hizo nuevos clientes y esto le ha permitido mantener activo el negocio y sobrevivir junto con su familia. Ella vende comida a domicilio, su esposo trabaja en una empresa haciendo bloques. 
Esta requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, carne, pollo. Pues son parte de la materia prima requerida para hacer sus platillos que vende durante la semana. Su meta es tener un comedor grande  para atender a más clientes y atenderles con precios justos.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, has four children, and has completed her primary school education. She is a businesswoman who lives in Managua, and started up a food sales business four years ago. When she first began her business, she only had three pounds of rice, a bit of red meat, and one liter of cooking oil. Even though she did not have much capital or raw materials, Maria did have deep motivation and a drive to succeed. Little by little, she kept increasing sales and adding new clients to her customer base, with both of those trends allowing her to keep her business active and support her family. She sells take out food dishes from her home, and her husband works at a block making company.

With the support from this loan, Maria plans to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, red meat and chicken, as these are all key ingredients in the food dishes she makes. Her goal is to eventually open and operate a dining hall so that she can accommodate more customers and offer affordable prices for her dishes.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, red meat and chicken for her food sales business.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Monsieur Assane est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal.  Il évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique  la vente de matériel de pêche telle que les filets, hameçons et autres. Puisqu’il exerce  son activité de commerce sur la plage il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu l’achat d’une charrette destiné à assurer  le transport des poissons achetés par les mareyeurs vers les centres frigorifiques moyennant une rémunération. Elle souhaite renforcer d’avantage ses gains financiers pour mieux supporter les charges de sa famille composée de  deux enfants  âgés respectivement de 3 ans et 7 mois.   Son projet futur est de devenir un grand promoteur de livraison de machines de pêche.
texts.en: Mister Assane is a married man who lives in Sénégal. Over the past 10 years he has has developed a business in selling fishing supplies such as nets, hooks, and other items. As he practices his trade on the beach, he is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to be used for buying a cart which he will use to make sure he can transport the fish he buys from the fish wholesalers to the refrigeration centers, earning a fee along the way. He hopes to reinforce his income in order to better support the financial needs of his  family, which is comprised of two children, one three years old and one seven months. His long-term plan is to become a major purveyor of fishing equipment delivery.

loans.use: to buy a cart for transporting fish.

loans.name: Zossi Rafiatou

texts.fr: Agée de 46ans, Rafiatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 20ans et 12ans. Spécialisée dans la vente du bois de chauffage, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des villages du Bénin. Sa clientèle est composée des détaillants et des ménages. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de finadev. Le bénéfice dégagé par ce micro crédit lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: At age 46, Rafiatou is married and the mother of three children, two of whom have completed school. The oldest and youngest are, respectively, 20 and 12 years old. Specializing in the sale of firewood, she buys her supplies in the villages of Bénin. Her customers include both retailers and household buyers. Toward the goal of enhancing her ability to meet the needs of her customers, she has sought out a micro-loan from Finadev Bénin [Kiva field partner], which will allow her to support her children's education and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
This is Chernor. He is 42 years old and married with two children ages seven and 19 years. In 2010, Chernor established a cement, soft drink, and water business to improve himself and his family. He works nine hours a day, seven days a week and earns about 500,000 SLL each month. 

Chernor is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to buy 20 crates of soft drinks, 30 bags of cement, and 500 containers of water. In the future, he plans to open more shops in different areas and provide a quality education to his children. Chernor thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cement, and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry and ladies bags

loans.name: Adikalie A.

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Adikalie. He is single and has one child who is eight years old and goes to school. In 2006, Adikalie established his phone accessories and top-up cards business. He began his business because wanted to continue working as he did while he was in school, even in university. He got his initial capital from driving a public motorbike for somebody. The payments he received were used to buy a motorbike for himself, which generated more income for him. He later decided to engage in selling top-up cards and phone accessories. Working seven days a week and sixteen hours a day, he earns about Le 5,000,000 every month from this business. 

Adikalie would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires the loan in order to buy Africel top-up Cards (54,000 units at Le 37,000); Comuim top-up cards (30,000 units at Le 33,000); Airtel top-up Cards (27,000 units at Le 36,000) and phone batteries (4 pieces at Le 10,000). 

In the future, Adikalie plans to provide quality education for his child, acquire a shop, complete his building construction and become an international businessman. Limited capital is his main challenge. He is a hardworking and honest business man. He thanks ARD for giving him additional capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Africel, Comuim, and Airtel top-up cards and phone batteries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, steel rods, and enamel paint in a very large quantities

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. For the past two years, Zenaida has operated a pharmacy. Her children also help her in managing her business. As of now, she has few customers and that’s why she decided to expand the variety of her goods. Zenaida wants to attract customers by providing the best affordable medicine as she knows that most poor people don't have enough money to buy expensive medicine.

Zenaida is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase additional medicine and other pharmacy products. Her goal is to always keep her business efficient, as it is the only source of income for her family. Zenaida doesn’t want to back-slide into the poor living she has experienced. She is doing her best to make her business live!

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine and other pharmacy products

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Osman. He is married and has two children, ages 6 and 2. He has two additional dependents living with him. In 2007, Osman established his mobile phone credit card business. He began his business because he wants to assist his family. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. Osman now requires a new loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to increase his inventory of credit cards and to buy one new Tiger generator for charging phone batteries. In the future, Osman plans to become an international business man and supply to other business men and women. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone cards

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Soy is a 57-year-old married mother who lives with her husband and seven children in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Out of her seven children, she still has six children to care for. One of her children works as a paid worker and the remaining five help with the family business. To support a big family, Soy works selling grocery items and her husband is a teacher in local area. Her family's daily income is approximately 45,000 KHR and they can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after their daily expenses.  

Soy has been with VisionFund for four cycles while her other loan group member have been with VisionFund from one to three cycles. She has fully repaid her previous loans which she used to provide her family with sufficient foods. Now, Soy is the group leader of her new loan group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a proper table for her family. Soy hopes her loan will improve her standard of living as well help increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy a proper table for her family

loans.name: Eusebia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eusebia, 51 años de edad, casada, madre 3 hijos, comerciante , se dedica alquilar  sillas y mesas para eventos. 	Inicio este negocio a los 44 años de edad, anteriormente se dedicaba a dar clases en las escuelas primarias pero noto que el servicio de alquiler era escaso y de necesidad y resulto algo muy rentable para ella. Ella desea agregar el servicio de decoración pues su idea es innovar y darle servicio agregado a sus clientes con todo lo necesario para eventos como bautizos, bodas, graduaciones, cumpleaños. 
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar manteles, mesas, cortinas, sillas. Esto le ayudara a brindarle un mejor servicio y conseguir más clientes para ampliar su negocio darse a conocer y crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 51 years old, is married and has three children. She rents chairs and tables for events. She started this business when she was 44 years old. Before that, she was engaged in teaching in primary schools, but she noticed that the rental service was limited and necessary, and it turned very profitable for her. She wants to add the service of decoration, because her idea is to innovate and provide additional services to her clients with everything needed for events such as baptisms, weddings, graduations, and birthdays.

She needs the loan to buy tablecloths, tables, curtains, and chairs. This will help her to provide a better service and get more clients to expand her business, make herself known, and grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, tables, curtains, and chairs.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, age 29, is a diligent farmer who lives with her spouse and two children in a village in the Thmor Koul district of the province of Battambang. All of her children are in her care and still in school. 

To support the family, Chan grows rice on a two-hectare area of farmland. Her husband is employed at a company in the local area. Having been in this business for four years, she and her husband are able to earn about KHR 40,000 per day. They manage to save about KHR 20,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. Her main challenge is a low crop yield due to drought.

Chan has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has fully paid back the past loans while the other member is just with VisionFund for this cycle. The previous loans have helped Chan to relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihood. 

Now Chan is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Chan will use her portion to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and insecticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her income so she can better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou engages herself in the buying and selling of different fish in the village. She has been patiently doing this for the past six years. She dreams to locate herself in a place where she does not have to walk every day just to sell. Because this is quite exhausting, she is doing her best to save for her dream.

To more easily achieve her dream, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy different fish varieties to sell, such as tilapia and bangus. These kinds of fish are in demand, so she needs to purchase them. She hopes that she can make her dreams into reality.

loans.use: to buy different fish varieties to sell, such as tilapia and bangus.

loans.name: Jessica Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jessica, es dueña de una pulpería, habita en la ciudad de Managua, casada, madre de un hijo de 7 años de edad. Inicio su negocio a los 24 años de edad, sus primeros productos de venta fueron las verduras porque era algo que las demás pulperías alrededor no vendía, invirtió más compra de frutas y verduras variadas esto le permitió tener capital para comenzar la pulpería y ofrecer diferentes consumos, vender ropa .  Esto le ayuda aportar en los gastos del hogar, ayudar a su mama y al mismo tiempo le brinda independencia económica.
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar granos básicos, verduras y cosméticos. Pues necesita tener surtido su negocio para satisfacer la demanda  de su clientela, mejorar los ingresos y aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es tener un espacio mas grande para tener una tienda de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Jessica lives in the city of Managua and owns a store. She is married and has a 7-year-old son. Jessica started her business when she was 24 years old. The first products she sold were vegetables because they were something not offered by the other stores around her. Next, she invested in fruits and a bigger variety of vegetables, which allowed her to earn the capital to open her own store and offer different goods, like clothing. This business helps Jessica to contribute to paying her family's household expenses, to help her mother, and a the same time, give her financial independence.

Jessica is requesting a loan in order to buy bulk grains, vegetables, and cosmetics. She needs to keep her business fully stocked in order to satisfy the demand from her customers, increase sales, and improve her earnings. Her dream is to one day have a bigger space in order to run her own clothing and cosmetics store.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, vegetables and cosmetics.

loans.name: 8 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de Marzo se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas. Se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Maria es una de las miembros de este grupo, comenta que se dedica a la venta de carnes, con lo cual está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza al máximo para poder ir creciendo como comerciante y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá surtirse y dar una variedad a sus clientes. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee "8 de Marzo" (March 8th) was formed by several neighbors of the city of Santaní, and all of the members are friends and neighbors. They got together with the desire to come out ahead and give their families all that they need in order to have a dignified life without deprivation.

Maria is one of the members of this group, and she tells us that she works selling meat. Through this work she is getting ahead and helping her family. She is a person who makes the maximum effort to be able to continue growing as a merchant, and in this way improve the conditions of her life.

She is requesting the loan to buy all kinds of cuts of meat. With this, she'll be able to supply her business and offer variety to her customers. They are all grateful for this opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 11 miembros donde todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Todas se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ser mejores cada día en lo que hacen.
La Sra. Zunilda trabaja como lavandera, y comenta que gracias a este trabajo está creciendo como microempresaria y ayuda a su familia. Gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia y está saliendo adelante.
Zunilda solicita el préstamo para la compra de jabones, suavizantes, aromatizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" is from the city of Santaní.  This group has 11 members who are all friends and neighbors from this city.  All of them are working hard to get ahead and become better each day at their job.  

Zunilda provides laundry services.  She comments that thanks to this work she is growing as a small businesswoman and is helping her family.  Thanks to her work, she is helping her family and is getting ahead.

Zunilda is requesting a loan to buy soaps, fabric softeners, deodorizers and other supplies so that she can keep on working and filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy soaps, fabric softeners, deodorizers and other supplies

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
San Vicente es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 10 miembros, donde todas ellas se esfuerzan al máximo por salir adelante y luchar contra la pobreza y así ayudar a sus familias.
Angelina es parte de este grupo y comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas de todo tipo, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, ya que las prendas usadas son muy solicitadas últimamente. Su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda de prendas usadas y de esa forma poder también seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas usadas, con las cuales podrá surtir su negocio y dar buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Vicente is from the city of Santaní.  It has 10 members, all of whom work their hardest to get ahead and fight against poverty to help their families.

Angelina is part of this group and she tells us that she sells all kinds of used clothing for a living.  It is going very well for her, as used clothing has been in high demand lately.  Her dream is to be able to have a big used clothing store, which will allow her to keep helping her family. 

She is asking for this loan to buy used clothing, which will allow her to stock her business and offer her customers a nice variety.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Angela Aleyda

texts.es: Ángela tiene 43 años de edad estado civil soltera ella tiene 1 hija de 17. Ella ha tenido que ser  madre y padre para su hija todo este tiempo. Pero ella ha salido adelante todo este tiempo ella comenzó a querer su negocio propio , por lo que hace varios años lo consiguió pues ahora cuenta con un asadero de pollo la cual hay vende comida en las tardes ya que trabaja desde la 11: am hasta 22.00pm. su anhelo es que su negocio crezca mucho .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: pollos, carne, colas etc.
texts.en: Ángela is 43 years old, single, and has one daughter, who is 17.  She has had to be both mother and father to her daughter for that entire time.  However, she has gotten ahead during that whole time.  She began wanting her own business and several years ago she got it.  She now has a grill for chicken where she sells food in the afternoons, working from 11:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She hopes that her business will grow a lot.  She wants this loan to buy chicken, meat, colas, etc.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, colas, etc.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.fr: Valerie est une femme de 37 ans, mère de famille.Elle gère un bar-restaurant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 04 ans déjà où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques et de la nourriture.Elle a acquise au fil du temps une expérience dans le domaine ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable. Malheureusement,la petitesse de son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement la demande de sa clientèle ce qui crée par conséquent une diminution importante de celle-ci ce qui entraîne de ce fait la baisse de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons et aussi les chaises pour agrandir sa structure. ce qui lui permettra de retenir et gagner la clientèle mais plus précisément d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. benefice qui lui permettra d'une part d'agrandir et d’aménager sa structure et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Valerie is a 37-year old woman, married, with children. For four years, she has been managing a bar-restaurant in one of the capital city’s districts. She sells health drinks and food.  Over time, she has acquired a good business experience, which allows her to attract a sizeable customer base. Unfortunately, the small size of her stock does not allow her to properly meet customer demand. This is a big disadvantage that causes a dip in her sales and thus in her revenues. Therefore she is seeking a loan in order to buy more cases of beverages as well as chairs to enlarge her business. This will allow her to attract and retain customers, and, more specifically, to increase her sales and her revenues. Her revenues will allow her to expand and equip her business and also provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to build up her stock of beverages and buy chairs.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Adama. She is married and has two children, ages 21 and 8. She has one additional dependent who lives with her as a sister.  

In 2005, Adama established her used bags business. She began her business to earn income so she could be of help to her husband. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Adama would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to buy four bails of used bags and to pay for transportation costs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 700,000. In the future, Adama hope to establish her business in another business center and deploy her sister there. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy four bails of used bags and to pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 57, has been working on her sari-sari (convenience) store business for eight years. With great effort, she managed to send her four children to school. Her business is a blessing to her because it provides her with income that she uses for her daily expenses. She wants to exceed the usual amount of income she earns to save for emergency purposes in the future.

Now, Elizabeth is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional goods such as 10 cases of soft drinks, a variety of canned goods and three sacks of sugar. She hopes to increase her sales through these additional products she will offer.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as 10 cases of soft drinks, a variety of canned goods and three sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith, a 43-year-old hardworking woman, has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. To help support the family, Judith offers the services of pedicure and manicure to individuals. She has applied for the loan of PHP 9,000 to buy a new nipper, pusher, nail polish and cuticle remover to make her job easier and increase income. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy new nipper, pusher, nail polish and cuticle remover.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La  Sra Elizabeth  tiene 30 años,  está casada hace 6 años, con el Sr Felix y  tienen 4 hijos por quienes ella y su marido se esfuerzan siempre por darles todo lo mejor.
Ella es oriunda de la ciudad de Atyrá  y vivió alli  hasta cuando tenía 10 años, luego vinieron con sus padres para buscar mejoras económicas, para entonces su mamá puso  un puesto de ventas de remedios refrescantes en el Mercado y la Sra Elizabeth cuando cumplió 14 años también fue a trabajar en ventas de mercerías y comestibles, más adelante se dedicó a la compra venta de frutas y verduras, para lo cual adquirió un vehículo para el transporte de los mismos.
Hoy día está muy contenta de todo lo que ha logrado porque pudo construir para su salón comercial en frente de su casa y habilitó una despensa bien surtida con ventas de frutas y verduras y según cuenta tiene muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar artículos de primera necesidad para poder surtir con buenos productos su despensa, ya que quiere poder comprar bebidas, panificados, frutas y verduras y demás insumos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 30, has been married to Felix for 6 years.  They have 4 children, and Elizabeth and her husband are always working to give them the best.

Elizabeth is a native of the city of Atyra and she lived there until she was 10 years old.  Later she moved with her parents to seek better economic opportunities.  Then her mother opened a stand selling herbal remedies in the market.  At the age of 14, Elizabeth also went to work selling food and notions.  Later she started buying and selling fruits and vegetables, and she acquired a vehicle to transport her products.

Today she is very pleased with everything she has accomplished, because she was able to build a commercial space at the front of her house where she set up a store that is well-stocked with fruits and vegetables, and she says that she has a very good customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy consumer staples so that she can stock up her store with good products.  She wants to buy drinks, bread, fruits, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, fruits, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Narcisa De  Jesus

texts.es: Narcisa De Jesús tiene de estado civil soltera tiene 1 hijo. ella vio a la venta de cosméticos como un buen ingreso para ella por eso se puso a vender cosméticos y le resulta muy bien  Su ingreso económico es con la venta de productos cosméticos ese ha sido su medio de sustento, pues le va bien en su negocio su sueño es incrementar mas su negocio poner más variedad a sus productos. Su horario de trabajo es en las tardes cuando les ofrece el producto  a sus vecinos. Su sueño es lograr una gran empresa de cosméticos y poder dar trabajos a muchas mujeres solteras Con el préstamo ella va a comprar todo lo que es cosmético como: perfumes, cremas, colonias etc.
texts.en: Narcisa De Jesús is single and she has one child.  She saw selling cosmetics as a good investment for her, which is why she started selling cosmetics, and it has been going very well for her.  The financial income from her cosmetics sales has been her means of support, as her business has been doing well.  Her dream is to expand her business further and have a wider variety of products.  She works during the afternoons, when she offers her products to her neighbors.  Her dream is to have a large cosmetics business and be able to give jobs to many single mothers.  With this loan she will buy all kinds of cosmetics, such as perfumes, creams, colognes, etc.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of cosmetics, such as perfumes, creams, colognes, etc.

loans.name: Erika Leonela

texts.es: Erika tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Ella comenzó en la venta de comida trabajando en un restaurante de un amigo, actualmente ella se independizo y trabaja junto con una amiga .Ella trabaja desde la 6.am hasta 15:00pm. Su meta es tener un gran restaurante de comidas típicas ecuatorianas .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina una y ollas y platos
texts.en: Erika is 27 years old, single, and has one child.  She started selling food working in a friend's restaurant.  Currently, she is on her own and she works with a friend.  She walks from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  Her goal is to have a big restaurant that serves typical Ecuadorian food.  With this loan, she wants to buy a stove, pots, and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a stove, pots, and dishes

loans.name: Musu J.

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Musu. She is married and has four children, ages 6, 13, 17 and 25. She has three additional dependents who live with her to help with the house chores.  

In 2009, Musu established her hairdressing business, which she started to help her husband who has retired from running the affairs of the house.

Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,795,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Musu has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional hair, hair products and cosmetics. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 782,600. In the future, Musu plans to improve her salon. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for hair and hair products.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has three children, ages 8, 15 and 24. She has three additional dependents who live with her to help in the business and the house chores.  

In 1992, Rugiatu established her cooking condiments business. She started this business to help her husband run and maintain their home. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,670,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. 

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy additional cooking condiments. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,500. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to improve her business and expand it to a shop as well as educate her children at a higher level. She thinks the loan will improve her business by increasing her stock, enabling her to earn more profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is an industrious mother and wife. She is helping her husband through her business making longganisa (Filipino sausage). She has been in this business for 15 years and she knows that one of the difficult problems in the business is financial insufficiency. She had experienced that difficulty. Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional pork and ingredients to make her specialty. This is due to the many orders of her customers that would be provided in the agreed upon period of time. Gina is hoping for the approval of her requested loan in order to gain higher income soon!

loans.use: to purchase additional pork and ingredients to make longganisa.

loans.name: Edward T.

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Edward.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 4, 7, and 15.  He has 2 additional dependents who live with him to help in the business as caterers.  In 2009, after retiring from government services, Edward established his food and drink business in order to be self-reliant.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,600, which is around 200 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Edward has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to increase drinks (soft drinks and beverages).  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 650,500.  In the future, Edward plans to open another outlet.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Kov's Group

texts.en: Kov is 50 years old and resides in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia. He is married and has nine children. Kov earns a living for the family through raising pips, a business in which he has been involved for 20 years. Kov’s group consists of three members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group representative, Kov is leading his group to request a loan in the amount of 160,000 KHR each. To promote sanitary and hygienic practices, with the requested loan portion, Kov is willing to build a proper latrine for his family. After the latrine is installed, he believes that he can create a healthier environment for his family and avoid unsanitary practices.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap, 33, resides in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Pheap is married with four dependent children. Three of them are currently in school and one is too young for schooling. Pheap makes her living through rice-farming, earning around 15,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 5,000 KHR after deducting her daily expenses. This will be her second loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan has helped her successfully cover the needs of the family. Now she is in need of money to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of plowing her rice field. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. She believes that, after receiving the loan, her business will provide her with good quality yields so that she can boost her income as well as better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Marie Ann

texts.en:
Marie Ann is 40 years old and has a business selling feed as a source of income. She is married and blessed with one child.  She has been managing her business for over three years. She is very patient and industrious. 
Marie Ann wants to increase her offered product but she suffers from fund deficiency. She decided to request a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy variety of feed. Hopefully, customers will respond to her new products.

loans.use: to buy variety of feed.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Jeheca Group

texts.es:
El comité "Aty Jeheka" es un grupo muy unido y trabajador de la ciudad de San Ignacio, todas ellas se pusieron como meta ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma poder salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos por medio de su trabajo.
La sra Juliana es una de las miembros, y comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida. Ella pondra el mayor de su esfuerzo para que su comité surja  y salga adelante, asi podra ejecutar su idea y plan de trabajo; asi mismo alentar a sus compañeras del grupo a seguir trabajando para el logro de sus objetivos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de yerba, harina, azúcar, leche, panificados y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá surtir su almacén y salir adelante y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Aty Jeheka Communal Bank is a very close and hardworking group from the city of San Ignacio.  All of its members set a goal to help each other and thereby be able to get ahead and help their own through their work.

Juliana is one of its members and she tells us that she has a well-stocked small grocery store.  She will put the better part of her energy into seeing that her communal bank develops and gets ahead, which will allow her to carry out her idea and her work plan.  This will also allow her to encourage her fellow group members to keep working to achieve their goals. 

She is asking for this loan to buy herbs, flour, sugar, milk, baked goods, and other supplies with which she will be able to stock her store, get ahead, and meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy herbs, flour, sugar, milk, baked goods, and other supplies

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina de 42 años casada con Marco Antonio de 56 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos y viven en una casa a base de material rústico que compró hace varios años casi al inicio de su matrimonio. Desde hace 4 años ella con el apoyo de su esposo se vienen desempeñando en el comercio de abarrotes, ubicado en su vivienda. Ella considera que es un buen negocio, porque gracias a ello ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder darles una buena educación. Sin embargo en todos estos años a tenido que lidiar con el desabastecimiento de los productos y la variación  de precios. La mejor manera de afrontar este inconveniente es realizando la compra de los mismos al por mayor y así poder tener siempre su negocio bien surtido, también creé que es posible a futuro llegar a ampliar su negocio, así como mejorar su local para así poder captar más clientes. Este es su crédito número 19 ; una vez mas se siente agradecido por el préstamo crediticio brindado, por tanto se compromete en ser puntual como en anteriores créditos. En su bando comunal es una socia que da ejemplo a sus compañero por su manera de responsabilidad con sus pagos. 
Con los  1,000  nuevos soles, Comprará un saco de arroz , conservas , verduras .
texts.en:
