Dina, age 42, is married to 56 year old Marco Antonio.  They have five children, and they have a house made from rudimentary building material.  They bought the house several years ago, almost at the beginning of their marriage.

Four years ago, with support from her husband, they have been selling groceries in their home.  She considers it to be a good business because, thanks to the business, she has managed to get her children ahead and give them a good education.

Nevertheless, in all of these years she has had to deal with the shortage of products and variations of prices.  The best way to face this inconvenience head-on is to buy the products wholesale.  This way she is able to always have her business well stocked.  Also, she believes it is possible, in the future, to expand her business.  She would improve her place in order to be able to win over more customers.

This is her tenth loan.  Once more, she feels grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to be punctual, as she was with previous loans.  In her communal bank she is a member who sets an example for her colleagues by being responsible with her payments.

She will use the 1,000 soles to buy a sack of rice, canned goods, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, canned goods, and vegetables.

loans.name: Shirley Mery

texts.es: Shirley tiene 31 años de edad estado civil casada tiene 1 hijo Cuenta que desde que su mama empezó a vender frutas ella le ayudaba, y ella me daba dinero por ayudarla. Asa que en el pasar del tiempo me compre una carreta en la cual trabaja actualmente mi sueño es tener un local para vender mis frutas. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar melón, naranja, guineo, huevos etc.
texts.en: Shirley is 31 years old, married, and has one child.  She tells us that she helped her mom since she started selling fruit and that her mom paid her for helping her out.  She did that until, after some time had passed, she bought herself a cart, which is where she currently works.  Her dream is to have a stall to sell her fruits.  She wants to buy melons, oranges, bananas, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy melons, oranges, bananas, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Madame Arame est une femme divorcée qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est divorcée et assure la charge de ses 5 enfants.    Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans la vente de denrées alimentaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits  alimentaires et de savon destinés a renforcer le  stock de sa boutique. Elle souhaite a travers son financement accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux supporter ses charges familiales. Son vœu futur est de disposer d’un grand magasin de stocks de produits alimentaire et de savon.
texts.en: Mrs. Arame lives in Senegal. She is divorced and takes care of her five children.    She has over 20 years experience in business, more specifically in the field of selling foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 cfa francs to purchase food items and soaps to increase to her shop's inventory. She hopes to increase her business' profits in order to take better care of her family. Her wish for the future is to manage a large store selling food and soaps.

loans.use: to purchase food items and soaps for resale.

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe Turamirize   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à  J. Pierre,  un  commerçant d’habits. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, dont 2 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce d’habits  depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce  aux bénéfices de son commerce, elle   habille ses enfants, les fait soigner  et elle a déjà acheté une parcelle.
texts.en:
Jeanine is a part of the group, Turamirize and she lives in Gitega. She is 27 years old and married to J. Pierre, a clothing retailer. Together the couple has two children, of whom two are in school.

She has been a clothing retailer for 5 years. 

She is on her 12th round of borrowing with Turame. With the loan from KIVA, she is going to increase her working capital and purchase a lot clothing for resale in order to earn more.

With the profits from her business, she is able to clothe and take care of her children and she has also already purchased a plot of land.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to purchase a lot clothing for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Sallieu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Sallieu.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 5, 8 and 15. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him to help in his  business.  

In 1997, Sallieu established his used clothing business. He started this business to be self-reliant after spending so much time in the mines.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Sallieu has already received and successfully repaid 3 previous loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional ladies used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 431,100. In the future, Sallieu plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town and to market day’s locations.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
Rey is age 27 and married with one dependent daughter, who is still under school age. Her family lives in a rural area of the Phnom Kror Vanh District of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living, Rey has been farming rice for six years, and her husband also contributes income by working for others for a fee in the local area. The current business earns her approximately 11,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient fertilizer to support her rice paddy is the main challenge.

This is the first microloan for Rey’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two members to apply for a loan. As the leader, Rey will use her portion of the loan for fertilizer for her farmland and labor costs to plow the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living .

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for plowing.

location.town: Pursat province, Phnom Kror Vanh district

loans.name: Ranulfo

texts.es:
El señor Ranulfo es de la ciudad de Pilar, es de profesión  Mecánico Tornero, hace trabajo de soldaduras en general. Cuenta que es muy conocido en su barrio y alrededores por el buen trabajo que hace.
Don Ranulfo es una persona que tiene muchas ansias de poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a las demás personas por medio de fuentes de trabajo. Solicita el préstamo  para compra de materiales para su trabajo, como ser soldadores y metales, y agradece nuevamente a la fundación paraguaya y a kiva por la ayuda y la gran oportunidad de crecimiento que recibe, ya que su negocio es su única fuente de trabajo con la cual ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
Ranulfo is from the city of Pilar.  He is a lathe operator by trade and he does general soldering work.  He tells us that he is very well known for his good work in his neighborhood and the surrounding areas.

Ranulfo is a person with a great desire to keep growing and helping others through work.  He is asking for this loan to buy materials for his work, such as soldering irons and metals. He also thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva once again for the help and the great opportunity for growth that he has received, as his business is his only source of work for helping his family.

loans.use: to by soldering irons and metals

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Khoudia est une femme célibataire qui vit au Sénégal.  Elle vend du petit-déjeuner est s’active dans le secteur  depuis plus de 10 ans. En meme temps elle évolue dans la vente d’habillement. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et   sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits pour enfants  destinés a la vente a l’occasion des préparatifs de la rentrée scolaire. Son objectif  est de disposer d’une boutique de vente d’habits pour enfants.
texts.en: Ms. Khoudia is a single woman living in Senegal.  She has had a small business of selling breakfast foods for over 10 years. On the side, she has started to sell clothing. She is a member of a branch of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 150,000 cfa francs to purchase children's clothing for resale during the time kids will start school again. Her goal is to own a shop to sell children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en: Ednalyn is 52 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a piggery business and requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ednalyn hopes to dispose them at high prices in order to ease her tiredness and sacrifices and also save for the unexpected events in her life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamin for her pigs

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en:
Ros is a 32-year-old widowed woman who has been farming rice as the main source of family’s income on two-hectare area of farmland for five years.  She is living in a wooden house in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, To add up to more income, she also sells rice soup in local area. Her daily income is approximately 18,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The main challenge for her paddy field is drought. 

Ros’ group composes of three members who live in the same village.  She has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles and had completely repaid back her past loans.  She wisely used the previous loans to constantly support her family livelihoods.  Now she and one of her group member are requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each, while the other one is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Ros will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to purchase piglets for raising in order to earn additional income. Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to better off her living lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is a 29-year-old farmer who lives in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are still too young for school, and one is in school. She has been farming rice on a three-hectare area of farmland for five years, while her husband has been involving in buying and selling corn and cassava to earn additional income. The current business earns her approximately 38,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sophy has been with VisionFund for four cycles and had completely repaid back her previous loans. She has used the loans to sustain her family's living condition. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan.  Sophy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets for raising to earn extra income. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Malin

texts.en:
Malin, aged 24, resides in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has one dependent son who is still under school age. To make a living, she has been engaged in rice farming on two hectares of farmland for three years and is also working as a tailor. Her husband supplements  their income by working as a transportation repairer in the local area. The current business earns her approximately 13,000 KHR per day for the family needs. Drought is the main challenge for her rice paddy business.

Malin is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to utilize this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy an air pump for her husband’s business.  She hopes this loan will help her husband to increase his income and also hopes to grow her rice healthfully and timely so as to make their living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 56 years old.  She is still single but she has an adopted daughter. For the past 11 years, Arsenia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells a variety of groceries. 

To help expand her business, Arsenia has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, bath soap, detergent and breads. This will help Arsenia to generate greater profits and expand her inventory and improve her livelihood. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to start another business where she will be selling wholesale.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Twenty-three-year-old Rose Ann is a hardworking mother who deals in a sari-sari store business. She has run this business for a period of six years. She started this endeavor to earn profit for the development of their living as well as to save for the educational purposes of her two children.  She says inadequate capital is the main factor affecting her business. Now, Rose Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy flour, oil, salt, vinegar, breads, snack food, soft drinks and beverages to sell. In the future, Rose Ann hopes for a comfortable living.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Ont's Group

texts.en:
Ont, 48, is married with three children. Her family lives in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has two children to take care of and they are still in school. To make a living, she has been engaging in farming rice on 1 hectare of farmland for several years and selling fish.  She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.  

Ont’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles.  Ont had fully paid back the previous loans, which have helped her constantly support her family with enough food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. Ont will use her portion to buy fish for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase more income so as to better her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.en: Nemecio is 51 and has one child. He started operating a transportation business 12 years ago. This source of income is sending his child to school, so Nemecio really loves his occupation. As a matter of fact, he is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy new wheels and other spare parts that he needs to maintain in his tricycle. In the future, he wants to see his child finishing his studies through his occupation and his sacrifices.

loans.use: buy wheels and spare part for his vehicle

loans.name: Rek's Group

texts.en:
Rek, 34 years old, is married and blessed with four children. Two of her children, one daughter and one son, are school age and dependent on her. One of her other children is working as a paid worker, while the other one is working as a rice farmer. 

Rek has been working as a rice farmer on her two hectares of farmland to earn income for the family, and her husband contributes income by working for others as a paid worker. Each day, Rek earns approximately 21,000 KHR and is able to set aside around 15,000 KHR for future needs. 

Rek has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in buying more plots of farmland to expand the rice farming business, which provides the main source of income for the family. Now she is leading a group of five female members to take out a new loan with VisionFund. With her new loan portion, Rek will buy fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes that, with the help of this new loan, she will be able to boost her income and help her children pursue their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es: Ada, habita en la ciudad de Managua, madre de 5 hijos , soltera, de oficio comerciante. Ella elabora y vende tortilla. Sus inicios fueron con 2 libras de maíz, al notar que sus vecinos le encargaban cada vez más tortillas se dedicó a vender por completo después vio que en su barrio no había un servicio de molino entonces decidió ahorrar para comprar el suyo propio y ofrecer al mismo tiempo el mismo servicio de molino y venta de tortillas. La necesidad y las ganas de surgir en la vida la motivaron a busca como emprender su propio negocio.  Sus hijas mayores la ayudan con el negocio. Con la idea de diversificar su negocio esta solicitando el crédito para comprar carne, maiz y vender por libra. Pues desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, además mejorar la infraestructura de su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Ada lives in the city of Managua, and is a single mother with five children. She operates a small business making and selling tortillas, and she started the business with only two pounds of corn. As she began making more and more tortillas, her neighbors kept demanding more, too. She then realized that no flour grinding services existed in her neighborhood, and so she decided to save up money and buy a flour mill. This machine and investment have expanded the scope of services she offers to her customers.

Ada's desires to provide for her family and get ahead have lead her to open her own small business, and her older children help her run the tortilla operation. Ada is requesting this loan in hopes of broadening the scope of her business. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase meat and corn for sale by the pound. She hopes this investment will help her improve her family’s quality of life, as well as to make improvements to her home

loans.use: to purchase meat and corn to sell by the pound.

loans.name: Francisca Catalina

texts.es: Francisca tiene 67 años de edad tiene hijos mayores de edad .ella vio a la venta de cosméticos como un buen ingreso para ella por eso se puso a vender cosméticos y le resulta muy bien  Su ingreso económico es con la venta de productos cosméticos ese ha sido su medio de sustento, pues le va bien en su negocio su sueño es incrementar mas su negocio poner más variedad a sus productos. Su horario de trabajo es en las tardes cuando les ofrece el producto  a sus vecinos. Su sueño es lograr una gran empresa de cosméticos y poder dar trabajos a muchas mujeres solteras Con el préstamo ella va a comprar todo lo que es cosmético como: perfumes, cremas, colonias etc.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 67, has grown children.  She saw cosmetic sales as a good income for herself.  Therefore, she started selling cosmetics, and it turned out very well for her.

Her financial income is from selling cosmetic products, and this has been her means of support.  Her business is going well for her.  Her dream is to increase her business by having a greater variety of products.

Her work schedule is in the afternoons, which is when she sells the products to her neighbors.  Her dream is to manage to have a large cosmetic company and to be able to give work to a lot of single women.

She will use the loan to buy all types of cosmetics like perfume, creams, and colognes, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and colognes, etc.

loans.name: Bundimasoli Kweyamba Group

texts.en:
Yeremiya is a forty-five-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been a fish monger for twenty years. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand from his customers and changes in the weather are his main challenges.

Yeremiya is a member of this loan group in which each member guarantees the other in repaying the loan. With his portion of this 12,000,000 UGX from HOFOKAM he will buy extra fish to sell.

Yeremiya intends to expand his fish business into new markets and buy land on which to grow crops. His ambition is to educate his children up to university level and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy extra fish to sell.

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis, 57 años de edad, viuda, madre de dos hijas, de oficio comerciante se dedica atender una pequeña pulpería en su casa. Puso este negocio para conseguir ingresos para ayudar a sostener los gastos de su familia. Le permitió desarrollarse como comerciante, a conocer más clientes y saber las necesidades. Antes vendía mercadería variada en el mercado junto con su esposo pero al  morir el , tenia que aprender a sobrevivir con sus propios medios.
Esta requiriendo el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, y productos lácteos. Esto le ayudara mantener productos en bodega que son de mucha  demanda y necesidad para sus clientes y que al  mismo tiempo le permiten mejorar sus ingresos. Uno de sus planes futuros es poner una mini tienda de ropa y mercadería variada.
texts.en:
Nelis, 57, is a widow and the mother of two daughters.  She's a merchant who has a small store in her house.  She installed this business to earn income to help support her family's expenses.  This allowed her to develop as a merchant, to meet more customers, and to understand their needs.  Previously she sold a variety of merchandise in the market with her husband, but when he died she had to learn how to survive on her own.

She needs the loan to buy basic grains, soda, and dairy products.  This will allow her to keep products in the shop that her customers want and need, and that also allow her to increase her income.

One of her plans for the future is to open a small clothing and variety store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, and dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and saucepans for the cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise and so set up shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat (canoe).

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, aged 44 years, lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with a responsibility of looking after four children. He cuts grass (using a lawnmower) and his clients are schools and hotels. He also has textile shop and his wife helps him out, since most of the time he is in the field working.

Like most good fathers, he wishes to educate his children up to the university. His business goal is to buy another lawnmower and expand his businesses to new areas. 

Mario needs the loan to buy clothes to sell, as the Christmas season is fast approaching.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one school-going child. He owns an electronic shop and an electrical repair shop, a business he has been operating for six years now.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are high taxes and the tedious and long process of getting licenses.

Wilson is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to buy electronic goods to grow the business, e.g. pumps, microwaves, etc. His extra income will be added to his savings to expand and improve his delivery service of his business. 

He aspires to expand and have a power house; employ workers and open other branches in the area.

loans.use: to buy electronic goods to grow the business, e.g. pumps, microwaves, etc.

loans.name: Clarence

texts.en:
Clarence is a 31-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has several businesses, including: stationery, secretarial services, internet cafe and mobile money.  He is also a civil servant. He hopes to have a permanent home, educate his children and buy a car despite challenges of  bad debtors, low stock and a poor mobile money network.

Clarence needs the loan to buy stationery and computers for his business.

loans.use: to  buy stationery and computers for his business.

loans.name: Vanadjum

texts.en:
Vanadjum, 48 years old, is a member of the vulnerable ethnic minority community of southern Albania.  He is married and the father of two children.  His children are 20 and 18 years old; one is a university student and the other one is high school student. They are Egyptians.

Vanadjum has his own business of inflating vehicle tires and his wife works a hair stylist. Both of them are proud of their accomplishments and for doing something different from the rest of their community:  Educating their children.

Vanadjum has had his business for the past ten years and it has grown and his sons are helping him out when they can. He is now requesting a loan to buy a tool to dismantle tires to make his job easier and faster.  He hopes that lenders will help him financially.

loans.use: To buy a tool to dismantle tires

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is 43 years old with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. For two years she has been operating a bar on a busy street, and with the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house. She is also farmer and a teacher. This has enabled her to provide basics to her family.

Customers not paying on time is a major challenge in her business. Yusta’s dream is to construct her own business premises, since the cost of rent limits her profits. She is a hardworking woman who works for 14 hours a day. Yusta is requesting a loan to buy a pool table for the bar.

loans.use: to buy a pool table for her bar.

loans.name: Munee

texts.en:
Munee lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a retail shop and sells clothes. The business has been operating for fifteen years. Munee started the business with her personal savings. 
Munee learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.
Munee is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to buy an additional stock of clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her repay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc. The business has been operating for three years. Miriam started the business through her personal savings. She is also employed as a teacher.

Miriam learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are bad debts.

Miriam is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, water, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help provide for her family. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, water, etc.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Don Marcelino 59 años de edad, es casado tiene 4 hijos, quienes ya son todos mayores e independientes. Nos cuenta que hace más de 15 años se dedica a la carpintería, pudo comenzar su actividad gracias al apoyo de su padre. Con la ayuda de su familia y gracias al trabajo arduo, su negocio fue creciendo rápidamente, y en la actualidad cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias para su actividad y le va muy bien ya que se hizo de buena fama en el barrio por el buen trabajo que siempre hace y gracias a ello ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de una herramienta para su taller, ya que posee gran demanda de sus trabajos, para así brindar mejor atención y rapidez a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 59 years old, is married and has four children, who are all adults and independent. He says he has been engaged in carpentry for more than 15 years. He began this activity thanks to the support of his father. With the help of his family and with hard work, his business grew rapidly and now he has all the necessary tools for his activity. He is doing very well because he got good reputation in the neighborhood for the good work he always does, and as a result he has been able to give his family everything they need for a decent life.

He is requesting a loan to buy a tool for his workshop, because he has great demand for his work, and thus he will provide better service and speed to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. She owns a transport business, which she has been operating for one year. This mode of transport is greatly preferred because of the bad road network, which is not accessible by other vehicles. She currently operates two motorcycles.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high transport and fuel prices, seasonal weather, and finding customers.
Josephine is applying for a loan of 67,500 Kenya shillings to purchase another motorcycle. Her dream is to see his business grow and to buy a three-wheeled vehicle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a charcoal shop, which he has been operating for five years.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel costs, and purchasing stock during rainy seasons.
Gilbert is applying a loan of 41850 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal wholesale. His extra income will be added to his savings to pay school fees, which has been a hassle due to lack of funds. Thus he can pay off the school fee balance for his son, who is finishing school this year. He hopes to continue with his business and to be able to improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy charcoal wholesale for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc. The business has been operating for five years. Edward started the business through his personal savings. 

Edward learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Edward is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, washing soaps, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to help him pay the loan. His future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, washing soaps, etc.

loans.name: Ramon Nonato

texts.es: Ramón Nonato de  67 anos de edad, casado con 6 hijos  mayores de edad independiente. Él es originario del departamento de León lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente. León se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, Ramón Nonato tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, hace 11 anos que tiene este negocio.  La pulpería es una tienda donde se venden productos al por menor como bolsitas de café, bolsitas champo, bolsitas de salsa de tomate, arroz, frijoles, jabón, azúcar, leche pan. Todos esto en cantidades pequeña. El negocio lo inicio como una forma de vida para tener ingresos para su familia, ya que no cuenta con ningún nivel académico por falta de recursos y dinero. Ramón Nonato agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciante de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Ramón Nonato, 67 years old, is married and has 6 adult children who are independent. He is originally from the department of León, which is in the western region. León is known for being a tourist area. Ramón Nonato works at a grocery store, which is in his home. He has had this business for 11 years. 

At the grocery store, he sells retail products such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, soap, sugar, milk, and bread. All of these come in small quantities. He started the business as a way to have income for his family, since he does not have an education due to a lack of resources and money. Ramón Nonato appreciates the help that Kiva lenders provide to small businesses with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua. This allows individuals to have a dignified standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock his store with daily consumer products such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, soap, sugar, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel de 59 años de edad. Casado con  1 hijo de 14 años, del departamento del Chinandega. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. El tiene por actividad económica una relojería la cual consisten en reparar reloj, vender repuestos de reloj, baterías de reloj, y también vende reloj nuevo. Negocio en el que se desempeña desde hace 34 años. José Daniel se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsable con su familia. En la vida él ha presentado muchos desafíos y problemas pero para el no ha sido impedimento para salir y seguir luchado por su hijo que es una persona especial que Dios se la regalado y puesto en su manos. Su hijo asiste a la escuela especial. El negocio lo inicio con un poco de dinero propio y en la actualidad ha sido su forma de vida. José Daniel ya ha recibido otros financiamientos y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar productos como reloj de mujer marca citizen, marca cariare, marca laris, reloj de hombre, respuesta como pulsera, baterías, pin. José Daniel agradece la ayuda que le brindan los  inversionista kiva a personas de escasos recursos  para tener un medio de trabajo digno en países de escasos recursos económico como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
José Daniel is 59 years old. He is married and has a 14-year-old son, in the Chinandega department, which is located in the western part of the country. His economic activity is a watches and clocks repair store, in which he repairs clocks and watches, he sells spare parts, batteries and new clocks and watches. He has had this business for 34 years.

José Daniel is characterized for being a very hard-working man, responsible to his family. He has encountered many challenges and problems in life, but this has not prevented him to succeed and continue fighting for his son, who is a very special person that God has given him and put in his hands. His son is attending a special school.

He started the business with a little amount of his own money and it has been his way of life. José Daniel has been granted financing before and he has shown his responsibility by both paying in time and the right amount. He is requesting the loan to invest in working capital and to buy products such as watches from brands like Citizen, Cariare, Laris, men's watches, spare parts like straps, batteries, pins.

José Daniel is grateful with Kiva lenders for the support they give to limited economic resources people to have a decent work in countries with lack of economic resources like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy spare parts for his clocks and watches repair shop.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 35, is a hardworking man hailing from Kagadi, Uganda. For three years, he has been operating a boutique. With the income he has earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and to buy land. He started with brick-laying and, after accumulating enough capital, he set up a boutique. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business, while his business plan is to move to new markets in various towns.
Vincent intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell, ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in his boutique.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, Florentine est mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Couturière de profession, elle a son atelier où elle vend des plateaux d'œufs et du miel depuis 02ans. Elle s'approvisionne deux fois par semaine dans l'un des marchés de la ville. Dans le souci d'accroître son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier à Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Florentine is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children who attend school.  Her oldest child is 13, the youngest is 7.

A seamstress by training, Florentine has her own shop where she has been selling egg trays and honey for the past two years.  She gets her supplies twice a week from one of the markets in town.

In order to increase her purchasing power and to meet the needs of her customers, she has applied for and obtained financial support from Finadev.  This will allow her to maximize her additional income and to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 liters of honey and 25 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Domingo Otoniel

texts.es: DOMINGO OTONIEL DE  50 AÑOS DE EDAD,CASADO CON UNA HIJA DE 22 AÑOS, LA CUAL ES INDEPENDIENTE ECONOMICAMENTE.  SE DESEMPEÑA COMO GUARDA DE SEGURIDAD INTERNA EN UNA EMPRESA DE LA LOCALDIAAD, TAMBIEN VENDE MEDICAMENTOS POPULARES PARA UNA EMPRESA DISTRIBUIDORA DEL MISMO. DOMINGO ES ORIGINARIO DE CHINANDEGA, QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAIS. EL FINANCIMIENTO LO ESTA SOLICITANDO PARA REALIZAR MEJORAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION QUE CONSISTEN EN LEVANTAR UN MURO PERIMETRAL EN FORMA DE ELE PORQUE EN REITERADAS OCACIONES HA SIDO VICTIMAS DE ROBO, Y NECESITO TENER PROTECCION PARA SU FAMILIA. MEJORAS QUE DESDE HACE UN AÑO LA HE QUERIDO REALIZAR PERO POR FALTA DE FINANCIMIENTO NO LA HE HECHO. CON EL FINANCIMIENTO COMPRARA  MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, ARENA, CEMENTO,CAL, BLOQUES, PIEDRIN HIERRO. DOMINGO OTONIEL AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LE BRINDAN LOS INVERSIONISTA KIVA A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSO Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA  PARA TENER UN LUGAR DIGNO PARA VIVIR.
texts.en:
Domingo Otoniel, 50 years old, is married and has a 22-year-old daughter, who is economically independent. He is an internal security guard in a local company. He also sells over-the-counter medicine for a company that distributes it. Domingo is a native of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country.

The financing he is requesting is to improve his house's condition. Such improvements consist of building a surrounding wall in an "L" shape, because he has been robbed in several occasions, and he needs to have protection for his family. He has wanted to make this improvements for a year, but because of the lack of financing he has not done it. With the financing he will buy the construction materials, such as zinc, sand, cement, lime, bricks, gravel and iron.

Domingo Otoniel would like to give thanks for the help provided by Kiva's investors to people with limited-resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to invest in buying construction material, such as zinc, sand, cement, lime, bricks, gravel and iron.

loans.name: G.s. La Holla Y El Comal Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario la Holla y el comal esta conformado por tres integrantes Rosaura Marisol, María Magda, Luis Alberto casados con 4  hijos bajo su responsabilidad todos menores de edad y están estudiando actualmente. Estos integrantes del grupo solidario son originario de la Paz Centro lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ellos son personas responsable, que se conocen entre si y se apoyan en sus diferentes negocios. María Magda es la coordinadora del banco comunal  la Holla y el comal y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa variada. La que compra en el Salvador y Guatemala. La cual distribuye de forma ambulante a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. Con la mayoría de sus clientes ella trabaja de crédito  y recupera quincenalmente. En la actualidad ella esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir un poco mas su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El grupo solidario la Holla y el Comal agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called “La Holla y El Comal” consists of three members: Rosaura Marisol, María Magda, and Luis Alberto. They are all married and have four young children among them who are currently in school. The members of the solidarity group are originally from La Paz Centro, a place that is located in the western part of the country. They are responsible people who know one another and support each other in their different businesses.

María Magda is the coordinator of “La Holla y El Comal” Communal Bank. She has a business of selling various types of clothing. María buys the clothes in El Salvador and Guatemala and then sells them as a street vendor to both established and occasional customers. She issues credit to most of her customers and collects payment every two weeks. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to invest as operating capital to buy a bit more inventory for her business so that she can meet the demand from her customers.

The solidarity group called “La Holla y El Comal” is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders have provided to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua. This enables them to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, and undergarments.

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Milagro de Jesús esta conformado por tres integrantes Maura Elena, Perfecta Rosa, María Mercedes, de las cuales dos son madres soltera y una casada con un total de 7 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ella pertenecen al municipio del Sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, crema, y por la crianza de cerdos, gallinas. Todas son mujeres muy responsable, trabajadoras. Maura Elena es la coordinadora del grupo ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de refresco y  crianza y venta de cerdos. Tiene 9 anos de tener experiencia en el negocio. Su rutina de trabajo es levantarse a las 5: am a preparar sus refrescos naturales para salir a venderlos de forma ambulante. Maura Elena esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en la comprar de frutas para elaboración de refrescos con: pina, sandias, melón, pitalla, cálala, naranjas. El g.s Milagro de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio trabajo digno.
texts.en: The solidarity group Milagro de Jesús is made up of three members: Maura Elena, Perfecta Rosa, and María Mercedes. Two of them are single mothers and one is married. Between them, they have seven children. They live in the municipality of Sauce, a place characterized by its production of milk, milk curds, and cream, and for the raising of pigs and chickens. All of the women are responsible and hard-working. Maura Elena is the group's coordinator. She works selling soft drinks, and also raising and selling pigs. She has been in this business for nine years. Her work routine is to wake up at 5 am and prepare her natural soft drinks in order to go out and sell them in the street. Maura Elena is applying for a loan to buy fruits such as pineapple, watermelon, melon, dragon fruit, passion fruit, and oranges, to make her drinks. The solidarity group Milagro de Jesús is grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with few resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to use as working capital to buy fruits like pineapple, watermelon, melon, dragon fruit, passion fruit, and oranges to make soft drinks.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur  Abdoulaye est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal.  Il évolue depuis plus de 5 ans dans le secteur du commerce.  Il pratique la vente de parfums de denrées alimentaires mais aussi de poissons fumés et sèches.  Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour élargir son commerce de parfums et de poissons séchés.  Les revenus qui lui procure  son activité  lui permettent  de supporter sa femme et ses  deux enfants. L’augmentation des ses bénéfices pourra l’aider à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son vœu futur consiste à voyager dans le monde et amener des conteneurs de divers produits.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a married man who lives in Senegal.  He has been working in retail for more than five years.  He sells perfumes and food products, as well as dried and smoked fish.

He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to expand his perfume and dried fish business.  With the income he makes from his activity, he is able to support his wife and two children.

Increased profits will help him to improve his family's diet.

In the future, he would like to travel throughout the world and bring in containers of various products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes as well as dried and smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married. Denis owns a tailoring shop, which he has been operating for five years. He also sells milk from his dairy cows. He employs two other people in the tailoring shop. He learned about Milango through a friend. He has the aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is lack of enough funds.

Denis is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy more materials for making dresses and trousers, as well as equipment needed for the tailoring shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to open additional tailoring shops.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making dresses and trousers, as well as to buy equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase retail stock for his business.

loans.name: Confraternidad -Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONFRATERNIDAD -CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia ella es soltera y tiene 35 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas,la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,platanos,mandarinas,als ocia tiene un local donde vende frutas,la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia se dedica 6 años a este negocio y le va muy bien,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar manzanas, naranjas, uvas, papayas y paltanos al por mayor.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de restaurant y negocio de venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Confraternidad - Cusco". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The member Livia is single and is 35 years old. The member works in her business selling fruits, she sells apples, oranges, bananas, tangerines, etc. The member has premises where she sells fruits. She works from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm, she has been engaged to this business for six years, and she is doing well. In her spare time, the member likes to go for walks. Her dream is to expand her business of selling fruit. The member is requesting a loan to buy apples, oranges, grapes, papayas and bananas wholesale.   

The member who has his picture stuck in the group picture had his photo taken after the photo because he asked permission for work reasons. The other members are engaged to the business of selling shoes, to the business of selling beauty products, to restaurants, and to the business of selling clothes. 

The member thanks to those who are part of this dream and agrees to comply with her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, grapes, papayas and bananas wholesale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two school-going children. The business has been running for the last three years. Apart from this, Daniel is also employed. Daniel learned about Milango through a friend, with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the outbreak of diseases, which can wipe out a whole batch of poultry at times. Daniel is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy a new batch of chicks and equipment (e.g., drinking cans). His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay for his children’s school fees and meet their daily requirements.

loans.use: to buy a new batch of chicks and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, and cooking oil for her cafe

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four grown children; only one attends school. Rosemary owns a clothes business, which she has been operating for five years. In this business she sells shawls, swimming costumes, shoes, etc.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds. Rosemary is applying for a loan of 26,250 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothes and shoes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a resident of Malindi of Coast province, Kenya. She has two school-going children.
  
Tabitha owns a food cafe, a business that she has been in operating for ten years. She learned about Milango through an employee with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are low income during low season and competition from the other traders.

Tabitha is applying for a loan of KES 21,050 to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, and cooking oil. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of the family, build a shelter for the family, and pay school fees for the children. 

She aspires to open a big restaurant in future.

loans.use: To purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos de uso personal desde hace un tiempo, motivada principalmente por la necesidad de generar ingresos con los cuales pudiera seguir cuidando a su madre que está con grandes dificultades de salud. Con este negocio ha podido mejorar los ingresos y esto le ha permitido ofrecer un mejor cuidado a su madre, y es por esto que siempre se esfuerza para seguir haciendo crecer las ventas. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene, Margarita busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de uso personal y así responder a las ventas de sus clientes que se incrementan en esta temporada.

Su sueño es poder mejorar los ingresos del hogar y también en un futuro poder abrir un almacén para generar empleo a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Some time ago, Margarita began working by selling personal use products. Her primary motivation was the need to generate income because she had to continue caring for her mother who has major health problems. Through this business, she has been able to improve her income so that she could provide better care for her mother. For this reason, she always strives to continue growing her sales.

Margarita is looking for ways to overcome the difficulty of accessing capital, so she is seeking a loan to buy a stock of personal use products. This will enable her to conduct sales with her customers since they increase during this season.

Her dream is to improve her household income. In the future, she also wants to open a store so that she can create jobs for her relatives.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 29 years old and married with two children.  He lives in Masindi, Uganda. For 5 years, Albert has been operating video shows.  Hhe started the business with savings from his salary as a teacher.  

Inefficient power supply and insecurity threaten his business profits,  however he has dreams of buying a standby generator, modernizing his cinema hall and diversifying his business to include motorcycle transport. His personal dream is to educate his children up to university level.  Albert needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Shufaa

texts.en:
Shufaa is a resident of Malindi of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has seven school-going children. Shufaa owns a food cafe - a business that she has been operating for 4 years. Besides this, Shufaa also owns rental houses from which she gets some income at the end of each month.

Shufaa learnt about Milango through an employee with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is low income during the low season and competition from the other traders.

Shufaa is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase cooking utensils and food like flour, sugar, cereal, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family, build a shelter for the family, and pay school fees for the children. She aspires to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and food like flour, sugar, cereal, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 50 years old and married with four children.

Erna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a spare parts business in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her business.

Erna has borrowed and paid 32 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spare parts business for 2 years and also earns an income from farming sugar cane and rice retailing.

Erna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Sylvie est une jeune femme de 36ans, mère de famille et vivant dans un quartier de la capital. Elle tient un comptoir depuis 04ans où elle vend divers produits. Grace à son dynamisme dans ce domaine, elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle solicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter (un sac de riz, un sac d'arachide, un sac de charbon quelque bidons d'huile, les condiments et le sel). Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'investir davantage dans son activité et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Sylvie is a 36 year old mother who lives in a district of the capital.  For four years she has managed a booth where she sells various products.  Thanks to her enthusiasm in this area, she has established a growing clientele that she would like to be able to continue to satisfy.  For this she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy a sack of rice, a sack of peanuts, a sack of charcoal, several barrels of oil, condiments, and salt.  The profits from this loan will allow her to invest more money in her business and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, peanuts and charcoal.

loans.name: Simei

texts.en:
Simei is a 50-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda.  He trades in cosmetics and empty jerrycans. He also looks after three orphans who were left after his sister died. 

He started the business with capital worth 3,000,000 shillings and it has now grown to six million over the years. Simei has challenges of price fluctuation and customers not paying on time, but hopes to increase his stock to 10 million and to venture into agriculture. He is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Felyn

texts.en:
Felyn is 39 years old and is engaged in selling bread as a source of income. She has been doing this for almost 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month, which is not enough to cover her necessities.

Felyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy flour, oil, sugar, and yeast for baking. She hopes these inputs will help to increase her income. After all, she is giving her best to produce a better income and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, and yeast for baking.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 31 years old and engaged in fattening hogs as a primary source of income. He was blessed with two children, and it is hard for him to provide for their living by meeting their needs, especially their education. Therefore, he usually experiences an insufficiency of funds.

He earns just PHP 5,000 each time it comes to sell a hog, and he hopes to increase his sales. Now he is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vitamins and two more hogs as additional sources of income. 

He hopes that his hard work and this loan amount will provide better living conditions and promote the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and two more hogs as additional sources of sales.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María de 62 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora.  María posee una tienda en la cual vende granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, pan, café, leche y otros productos más los cuales son para el consumo diario y así mismo para el uso diario del hogar. María debe trabajar muy duro día con día para poder salir adelante ya que gracias a este negocio es como ella puede aportar para el bienestar de su hogar, es por esto que ella desea mucho poder obtener un crédito con INTEGRAL, y poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos para la tienda. De esta manera ella espera poder ver el crecimiento de su tienda, y así contar con un negocio más estable el cual le brinde la tranquilidad que María desea para su vejez.
texts.en:
María, 62 years old, is a very responsible and hard-working woman. María owns a store in which she sells grains, instant soups, bread, coffee, milk and other products which are for daily consumption and at the same time for daily use at home.

María has to work hard every day in order to progress, because thanks to this business she is able to contribute to the well being of her home. This is why she really wishes to obtain a credit with INTEGRAL, in order to be able to buy a larger amount of perishable products for the store. This way, she hopes to see her store growing and have a more stable business, which brings the kind of tranquility María wishes for her old age.

loans.use: to buy perishable products.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es: Edith de 29 años de edad, es una persona que trabaja muy duro para que su familia pueda contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida estable y feliz. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Edith trabaja en su propio negocio haciendo tortillas a los mediodías y por las noches elaborando pupusas, las ventas están ubicadas en su casa de habitación y posee varios clientes. Edith solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como maíz, frijoles, verduras, queso, chicharrón y otros más de manera que pueda incrementar su producción y así de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edith is 29 years old.  She is a strong and hard-working person that her family can count on for everything they need to have a stable and happy life.  She lives with her husband and two minor children.  

Edith runs her own business making tortillas in the afternoons and making pupusas (a type of Salvadorean pancake similar to a tortilla) at night .  She runs the business from her own home and has a number of customers.  

Edith is asking for a loan with the intent of buying a large amount of basic ingredients such as corn, beans, vegetables, cheese and chicharrón (a type of fried delicacy in El Salvador), as well as other items so that she can increase her production and thereby supplement her sales.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and two pigs.

loans.name: Sherry Ann

texts.en:
Sherry Ann is 34 years old, and she has a piggery business as a source of income. She has administered her business for over one year, earning an average amount of PHP 8,000 every disposing season. 

She wants to improve her income but the lack of capital hinders her. Thus she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional working capital to buy five sacks of feed and vitamins. 

Through this, she can earn greater net sales per month that she can use for the educational purposes of her three children.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is engaged in direct selling of Natasha products.  She is 43 years old and blessed with five children. She is sending all of them to school. 

Although it is difficult to send them all at a time, she has never quit.  Instead she pursues and works hard to provide their educational needs.

She is asking a loan of  PHP 12,000 to buy additional Natasha products to offer. She hopes this will become a big contribution to lifting their living condition and helping prosper her business.

loans.use: to buy additional Natasha products to offer.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco  tiene 33 años, se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es mecánico hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la zona 12 de Octubre de la ciudad de El Alto donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Marco  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de repuestos y herramientas y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Marco va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, Marco es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Marco is 33 years old, he repairs cars, and has been a mechanic for several years. He has his workshop located in the area of 12 de Octubre in the city of El Alto, where he offers his services. 

This loan is his first sequence within the institution. Marco will use the loan to buy spare parts and tools, and thus provide a better service to his clients and increase his profits. The reason to apply for this loan is to keep improving in his activity. Marco will use the benefits to keep buying tools to equip his workshop. Marco is a hard-working person, and is happy for the opportunity given with the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora de 54 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos mayores de edad. María Auxiliadora corresponde al municipio de la Paz Centro lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. María Auxiliadora es una mujer que se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, humilde luchadora para sacar a sus hijos adelante. María tiene  por actividad económica un kiosco el cual esta ubicado en un lugar especifico de su comunidad.  El negocio consisten vender productos comestibles como jugos, frescos, gaseosas, reposterías, golosinas. La rutina diaria de María de trabajar 10 horas diaria habré su negocio a las 7: pm y cierra a las  pm. María ya ha  trabajado con fundación león 2000 el cual ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. La  Sra. Agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora, age 54, is a single mother with two grown children. She lives in the town of La Paz Centro, which is located in the western part of the country. María Auxiliadora is a woman who is known for being hardworking, responsible, humble, and determined to move her children forward.

María has a kiosk that is located in a specific spot in her community. Her business consists of selling food products such as juices, soft drinks, sodas, pastries, and candy. María’s daily routine consists of working 10 hours a day. She is already a client of Fundación León 2000 and has demonstrated that she is responsible in submitting her payments on time. Sra. María is grateful for the assistance that Kiva has provided to people who have limited resources and live in poor countries, such as Nicaragua. This enables people like her to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, sodas, pastries, and candy.

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: Monsieur Libasse est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal.  Il  est enseignant de profession depuis 5 ans. Dans le souci de diversifier son activité il ambitionne d’entamer une seconde activité de prestation de services. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chaises et de bâches destinées a la location pendant les événements et cérémonies( mariage, baptêmes). Les revenus que lui procure de son commerce lui permettent de supporter les charges quotidiennes de  sa famille. Il est père de 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 5 et 3 ans. Son projet future est de mettre en place une école privée.
texts.en: Mr. Libasse is a married man who lives in Senegal.  He has been a teacher by profession for five years.  In hopes of diversifying his business, his goal is to start up a second service business.  He is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 400,000 frs for the purchase of chairs and canvas covers to be rented for ceremonial events such as marriages and baptisms.  The income from his business will allow him to meet the daily needs of his family.  He is the father of two children aged 5 and 3 years.  His future goal is to establish a private school.

loans.use: to buy chairs and canvas covers to rent.

loans.name: Umuco Ii Group

texts.fr:
Fédeline fait partie du groupe Umuco II  et  habite à Kayanza .Elle a 50 ans et est mariée à  Moїse,  un  chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 19 ans et qui étudie.
Elle prend soins de 5 personnes qui étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce des habits,et elle est aussi tailleur depuis  26 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des pagnes à revendre, des tissus pour coudre les habits à vendre, ainsi que les pièces de rechange pour sa machine à coudre. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  faire l’agriculture et l’élevage modernes. Elle voudrait en outre voir son enfant arriver à l’Université.
texts.en:
Fédeline is a member of the Umuco II group and she lives in Kayanza.  She is 50 years old and married to Moїse, a driver.  They have a 19-year-old child who attends school.  Fédeline has five students in her care.

She sells clothes and she has been working as a tailor for 26 years.

This is her 12th loan with Turame.  With the loan that she is receiving from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) for resale.  She will also purchase fabrics with which to sew clothes that she will sell, and some spare parts for her sewing machine.

In the coming years, she would like to be involved in modern agriculture and animal-husbandry.  She also wants to see her child go to university.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy "pagnes" for resale, fabrics to make and sell clothes, and to buy spare parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Horimbere Group

texts.fr:
A. Marie fait partie du groupe  Horimbere et habite à Gitega. Elle  a  36 ans et est mariée à Christophe, un commerçant . Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgés de 3 à 13 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de produits vivriers (haricot, riz, huile de coton) depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit à  Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’huile de coton  et   de riz à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle nourrit  et assure  les soins de santé de sa famille. Elle paie aussi les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A. Marie is part of the Horimbere Group and lives in Gitega. She is 36 years old and is married to Christophe, a shopkeeper. Together they have five children, from three to 13 years old, four of whom are students.

She has been selling food products (beans, rice, cottonseed oil) for 20 years.

A. Marie is on her 16th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she will secure, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of cottonseed oil and rice to resell, in order to earn more.

Thanks to the profits from her business, A. Marie feeds and sees to the health care of her family. She also pays her children's school fees.

loans.use: To increase her capital and to purchase a large quantity of cottonseed oil and rice to resell, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Paz

texts.es:
Paz de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Pablo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa de cama, además para complementar los gastos del hogar a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo; tiene quince años de experiencia en su trabajo, gracias al cual ha recibido gratificantes satisfacciones, pues le permite proporcionar un importante aporte a los gastos del hogar para que la carga económica no recaiga sólo sobre su esposo, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda, lugar estratégicamente establecido ya que es una zona muy transitada por clientes potenciales de otras localidades. Se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a buenos precios y con un excelente servicio. 

Paz es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, y con muchas metas que desea cumplir, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo y cada vez mas se acerca a su objetivo que es alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión en éste último trimestre que resta del año, en el que normalmente sus productos son mas demandados, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas y cosméticos. Paz tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una vida mejor fruto de las ganancias.
texts.en:
Paz, 56, lives with her life companion, Pablo, and their children. She works making and selling bed linens and to add to family income also sells cosmetics from catalogs.  She has 15 years’ experience in her work and is satisfied with her accomplishments because they allow her to be an important support in regards to the household expenses so that they don't only fall on her husband.  The business is located at home, a strategic location where there are many potential clients from other areas.  She’s acquired a large, regular clientele because people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices and with excellent service.

Paz is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals to reach.  She strives daily to the maximum degree and is nearer her goal of attaining success every day.  Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment in the last quarter of the year during which there is more demand for her products.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabric and cosmetics.  Paz de la Cruz has good payment references and assures that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Abigail

texts.es: Rosa de 50 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Rosa es una mujer que cuenta con el atributo de ser muy responsable y alegre a quien le gusta dedicarse de lleno a lo que hace. Ella posee una venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad, ya cuenta con varios años de trabajar de esta manera lo que le ha permitido ir obteniendo clientes fijos a lo largo del tiempo. El mayor deseo de Rosa es el de aumentar sus ventas y poder vivir de una mejor manera junto a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar variedad de verduras, así mismo comprar frutas para comercializar y de esta forma crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Rosa, 50, lives with her two children, both students.  She is a responsible woman, friendly and fully committed to whatever she is doing.  She operates a produce sales business in the local market.  She has operated the business for many years and can rely on the loyal set of customers that she has gained in those years.  She says that her hopes for the future are to grow her business and provide a decent life for herself and her family.  She is applying for an INTEGRAL loan that she will use to buy fruits and vegetables that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her fruits and vegetables business.

loans.name: Rosa Lucrecia

texts.es:
ROSA LUCRECIA tiene 77 años de edad de estdo civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los platanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventnas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Rosa Lucrecia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Las compras las realizará en Mocache. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. El sueño es comprar héctareas de terreno para sembrar más maíz. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar 
quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lucrecia is 77 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has no children. She lives with her husband in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Rosa is a member of the September 5th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Los Platanos in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and raising livestock.

Rosa Lucrecia is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer. Her purchases are conducted in Mocache. With the help of this loan, she will buy what she needs to plant her crops. Her dream is to buy plots of land so that she can plant more corn. The challenges she faces include dealing with pests.

In her free time, Rosa Lucrecia enjoys taking care of the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Kelly Gisella

texts.es:
KELLY GISELLA tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene una hija, vive con el conyugue y la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

KELLY GISELLA se dedica a la agricultura, además cría animales cómo pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas.

 El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Kelly Gisella, 28, is in a common-law marriage and has a daughter.  She lives with her partner and her daughter in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios province.

Kelly is a member of the "5 de Septiembre" communal bank, which is located in Recinto Los Platanos in Ventanas canton, a place devoted to agriculture and livestock production.

Kelly Gisella is a farmer who also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid brushkiller.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers she needs for her crops.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Kelly's dream is to buy land where she could build her own house.  In her free time, she enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, and liquid brushkiller

loans.name: Anastasie Vihoutou

texts.fr: Anastasie est âgée de 48ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 28ans. Elle vend des divers et des légumes depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce crédit lui permettra d'achever la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
Anastasie is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are already financially independent.  Her oldest child is 32 years old and the youngest is 28.

She has been selling various goods and vegetables for a few years and she stocks up at a market in Benin.
